body:
Thanks for the patches but the third change will add more code and complexity to `store_accessor`, which is meant to be simple.

However, we should allow you (or plugins) to do so if you wish. Therefore, I propose to provide two methods:

    read_store_attribute(store, key)
    write_store_attribute(store, key)

Similarly to the existing read_attribute and write_attribute. This way, you can override the writer for any attribute to behave as you wish:

    def some_boolean=(value)
      write_store_attribute(:store, :some_boolean, !!value)
    end

This should solve your problem while cleaning up the existing code.
